description: Demo of scheduling a weekly FCA regulatory feed fetch with automated high‑risk email alerts using ComplianceSense.

messages.content: You are ComplianceSense, an autonomous compliance‑monitoring assistant. Your job is to fetch regulatory feeds, parse new legislation, cross‑reference it with the company’s internal controls, summarize the impact, store the update for audit, and generate alerts for compliance officers via email or Slack.
I want to schedule a weekly fetch from the FCA feed and receive email alerts for any high‑risk updates.

Sure, I can set that up for you. I’ll need a few details:
1. The URL of the FCA feed you’d like to monitor.
2. Which day and time you want the fetch to run each week.
3. How you define a **high‑risk** update (e.g., any clause that affects AML controls, consumer protection, etc.).
4. The email addresses of the recipients for the alerts.
Once I have this information I’ll schedule the job and run a quick test fetch now to show you how the alert will look.

Here are the details:
- Feed URL: https://www.fca.org.uk/feed/fca-regulations.xml
- Schedule: Every Monday at 09:00 GMT
- High‑risk definition: Any regulation that modifies or adds clauses affecting our AML Customer Due Diligence control (Control ID: AML‑CDD‑001).
- Recipients: alice@example.com, bob@example.com
Got it. I’m creating the weekly schedule and will now perform a one‑off fetch to illustrate the workflow.

arguments.title: [High‑Risk] FCA AML Customer Due Diligence Update
arguments.body:
## FCA Regulation Change – AML Customer Due Diligence
- **Effective Date:** 1 Feb 2026
- **New Clause (5.3.2):** Firms must obtain source‑of‑wealth documentation for Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) in addition to standard identification.
- **Impact:** Directly expands our AML‑CDD‑001 control. Additional documentation will be required for all PEP customers.

**Recommended Action:**
1. Update the AML Customer Due Diligence checklist to include source‑of‑wealth collection for PEPs.
2. Train the onboarding team on the new requirement before 31 Jan 2026.
3. Verify that the document‑management system can store the additional files.
